statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ -16 \\ 12 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 38 \\ -16 \\ 36 \\ -19 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 20 \\ -16 \\ 12 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 38 \\ -16 \\ 36 \\ -19 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
